questions.question: For what type of material does these threading techniques can be made possible:

explanations.a: Thread rolling requires plastic deformation, hence ductile materials are suitable.
explanations.b: Brittle materials cannot undergo plastic flow.
explanations.d: Toughness is not the deciding factor.

questions.question: These techniques of threading cannot improve the following properties:

explanations.a: Yield strength improves due to cold working.
explanations.b: Hardness increases due to strain hardening.
explanations.c: Resilience is not improved by thread rolling.
explanations.d: Wear resistance improves due to better surface finish.

questions.question: The flow of material in thread rolling process takes place in which direction:

explanations.a: Material does not flow along length.
explanations.c: Material flows radially into thread shape.

questions.question: Through which process thread rolling cannot be done:

explanations.b: Punch and die is not a thread rolling method.
explanations.c: Two rolls with guide is a valid method.

questions.question: In which type of thread rolling technique, the two dies reciprocates:

answers.a: in two rolls with guide system

explanations.a: Rolls rotate, they do not reciprocate.
explanations.b: Flat die systems use reciprocating dies.
